name: Little Waves
description: Little Waves Coffee Roasters is an award winning impact-driven group of thinkers, dreamers, and doers who delight in the enduring power of coffee as a shared experience. By making small, determined reverberations through sourcing, roasting, and brewing, we add our open-hearted energy to the tides that unconceal and uphold the beauty of coffee and life.

notable: 2022 roaster of the year - Roast Magazine
Co-Founder & Green Buyer, Areli, Selected as 2025 Sprudge Twenty

name: JBC
description: Unparalleled quality, a human story, and sustainability – that’s our coffee philosophy.

notable: One of 28 Best Coffee Roasters in America 2022 - Gear Patrol
Six Time Good Food Award Winners (2016, 2018, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2025)

name: PERC
description: Our mission is to share good times and awesome coffee with you at every step of your coffee journey. We source mind-blowing coffees from the world’s top producers and roast them with love and relentless curiosity. Our roast profiles maximize the natural sweetness and character of each coffee. We’re super excited about these coffees and we’re thrilled to share them with you!

name: ONYX
description: Years ago we started telling each other to “Never Settle for Good Enough.” It felt perhaps like a piece of branding or a slogan, but over the years this mentality has developed into a mantra of its own that permeates every thing that we do at Onyx.

notable: Good Food Award Winner - 2014, 2015, 2019
2024 10 Best Independent Coffee Shops - 4th Place, USA Today

name: Utopian
description: Utopian Coffee is a coffee roaster founded in 2006. Utopian Coffee is known for its unparalleled commitment to sustainably harvested coffee.

name: Hydrangea
description: Light, Fruit-forward, Experimental Coffees Process. Enhancing flavor development through modern fermentation techniques.

name: Broadsheet
description: Discover the finest specialty coffee at Broadsheet Coffee Roasters, just a five-minute walk from Harvard Yard in Cambridge, Massachusetts.

name: Prodigal
description: A specialty coffee roaster based in Boulder Colorado, founded by Scott Rao and Mark Benedetto. The company focuses on light roasts with high consistency, achieved through a rigorous quality control process that includes blind cupping, strict roasting targets, and optical sorting of green beans.

name: Modcup
description: With high quality coffee, lighter roasting is better. We roast delicately to preserve the coffee’s natural aromas and brightness.

notable: 4th place in CoffeeReview Top 30

name: Driftaway
description: Our mission is to build an equitable value chain by prioritizing women & minority producers, and we want to make coffee accessible and fun for all consumers.

notable: 2026 Roaster of the year - Roast magazine

name: Wonderstate
description: Wonderstate Coffee has been dedicated to roasting exceptional, ethically sourced coffee that sparks connection, inspires curiosity, and nurtures communities.

notable: 2025 Roaster of the year - Roast magazine

name: Ceremony
description: We’ve always believed coffee should be something special, and this simple thought moves us every day to source smarter, roast better, and delight more people again and again.

name: Little Wolf
description: Passionate about making good coffee, we source only the highest quality green coffee and work with those who seek to do the same. We roast a small, intentional selection with care to bring forth the unique qualities of each one, highlighting what makes them special.

name: Red Drum
description: Red Drum Roasters emerged in 2022 from a happy intersection between Thomas’s years of home roasting and the opportunity to found a Durham roastery focused specifically on serving the Durham Farmers Market.

name: Flower Child
description: Flower Child is a small roasting and green buying project that is a product of years in the industry. We are procuring the finest green coffees we can find and roasting for clarity. Our approach to roasting aims to transparently showcase each coffee without adding too much or too little development.

name: Parlor
description: Founded in 2012 as an underground roastery and pocket square-sized espresso bar, Parlor’s roastery and headquarters now sit on the border of Brooklyn’s historic Navy Yard. Roasting to order every Sunday through Thursday, the team behind Parlor Coffee is dedicated to raising the bar of coffee culture in NYC and beyond.

name: Hex
description: HEX began as a simple pop-up in charlotte, n.carolina in 2015 with the goal of creating warm, inviting spaces in unfamiliar places and bringing bright, vibrant coffees to our community.

name: YES PLZ
description: We believe great coffee should be for everyone. We started YES PLZ on the simple but bold premise that the best coffee you drink should be coffee you made in your own kitchen — and it’s easy when you begin with great beans.

name: Klatch
description: Klatch is a family-owned and run coffee company based in Southern California and distributed worldwide. We source, roast, and brew our own coffee and apply our scientific method to accomplish a taste best described with expletives and exclamations. Some say it’s obsessive, we say it’s fun.

notable: Micro Roaster of the Year: 2009 - Roast Magazine
Overall Champion: 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018 - Golden Bean

name: Amavida
description: We’re leveraging coffee to make the world better. See how we’re pushing the limits of sustainable sourcing and roasting at Amavida Coffee.

notable: 2018 Roaster of the year - Roast magazine

name: Bolt Coffee Co
description: We aim to foster meaningful connections by bringing people together in our spaces. We’re grateful to do so through intentionally sourced, roasted, and prepared specialty coffee. Initially offering coffee from a single cart at weddings and a downtown pop-up location in 2012, Bolt now serves the Providence community from two retail locations and a production facility on Smith Hill.

notable: Best Coffee Roaster 2022 - Food & Wine

name: Counter Culture Coffee
description: Counter Culture Coffee is a specialty coffee roaster sourcing exceptional single-origin and specialty coffee. Fresh-roasted coffee to your doorstep.

name: Archetype Coffee
description: Serving small batch roasted coffee, lattes, cappuccinos, macchiatos, or in-house brewed chai, Archetype Coffee is the place to go in Omaha. Visit us in the Blackstone District or Little Bohemia.

name: Duck Rabbit Coffee
description: duck-rabbit coffee is a coffee roaster in Cleveland, Ohio, US. We are dedicated to offering some of the world’s most incredible, interesting, hard to reach, rare, exotic, and, of course, delicious coffees. We aim to put forward a diverse, well-balanced, interesting, exciting, and frequently rotating menu of coffees fit to satisfy a wide range of tastes, interests, and brew methods.

name: Equator Coffees
description: Equator Coffees is a coffee roaster, cafe operator, and coffee farm owner. Founded in 1995, Equator is known for a commitment to sustainably harvested coffee.

name: Flatlands Coffee
description: Flatlands Coffee — Ohio-based roastery (please confirm specific city/founding details).

notable: 2022 Best Roaster in Ohio - Food & Wine
3 2019 Bronze medals - Golden Bean

name: Joe Coffee Company
description: Joe Coffee Company — New York City-based roaster and café group offering coffee education, wholesale, and nationwide shipping.

name: Lima Coffee Roasters
description: LOVE PEOPLE. LOVE COFFEE. A local, small batch coffee roastery passionate about serving others.

notable: 2023 Community’s Choice Award for Best Local Coffee Shop
2025 Best of NOCO

name: Madcap Coffee
description: Madcap Coffee’s mission has been to unveil the inspiring craftsmanship and human touch in every cup of specialty coffee, transforming an ordinary daily ritual into an elevated experience. We’re a Michigan roaster with locations in Grand Rapids, Detroit, and Leland

name: Nightswim Coffee
description: Night Swim Coffee is a Specialty Coffee Roaster born in Charlotte, North Carolina as the centerpiece of a unified venture for Not Just Coffee and Undercurrent Coffee. We strive to narrate the coffees we roast, honoring the places they come from and the people that dedicate their lives to producing them.

name: Partners Coffee
description: Partners Coffee is a specialty coffee roaster based out of Brooklyn with an unwavering commitment to sourcing and roasting quality coffee.

name: Passenger Coffee
description: Passenger exists to seek out and thoughtfully present extraordinary coffee and tea that we strive to source from long-term, farmer-focused partnerships.

notable: Best Coffee Shop in Pennsylvania (2022)
est Coffee Roaster in Pennsylvania (2022)
Featured on Best Coffee Shops in America lists (2018, 2019)

name: Red Rooster Coffee
description: Red Rooster roasts coffees of exceptional quality, with unmatched attention to social and environmental responsibility.

notable: 3 time Good Food Awards Winner
Annual Top 30 Coffees on Coffee Review, 2015-2018, 2020-21, 2023
50+ coffees scoring 90+ on Coffee Review

name: Regalia Coffee
description: Regalia stands ahead of the curve through its unparalleled roast consistency and quality control metrics. Lead by international roasting instructor Paolo Maliksi, the team at Regalia curates a menu that juxtaposes exemplary lots of traditionally processed coffees alongside innovative, designed-fermented coffees from leading world-class producers.

notable: 1st place, Filter - Experimental Processing - GLOBAL COFFEE AWARDS 2025
Best Coffee Subscription - GQ Magazine

name: Sunday Coffee Project
description: ☀️ coffee, apparel & lifestyle goods ☀️

name: Sweet Bloom Coffee
description: Get beautiful, freshly roasted coffee from what Food & Wine magazine has called the best coffee roaster in Colorado.

notable: Two-time U.S. Brewers Cup Champion
World Brewers Cup Championship runner-up

name: Verve Coffee
description: Order Coffee Online from Verve Coffee Roasters. Hand-roasted daily, enjoy craft coffees with unique tasting & roasting profiles. We are committed to innovation and equitable direct trade that plays an active role in every step of the supply chain, investing in individual producers across the globe. We recognize that a producer’s dedication and years of knowledge are fundamental to the caliber and character of the coffees we’re obsessed with and known for.

notable: Roaster of the year 2024 - Roast Magazine

name: Wrecking Ball Coffee
description: Wrecking Ball Coffee Roasters is a coffee roasting company in the San Francisco Bay Area founded in 2011. We’re working to become the area’s most recognized purveyor of sustainably sourced, expertly roasted specialty coffee, presented with unparalleled service.

notable: Owner Trish Rothgeb credited with coining the term ’Third Wave Coffee’

name: Black & White Coffee Roasters
description: At B&W, we’re committed to connecting people to the most interesting and approachable coffees that we can find. We strive to be more than just a quality coffee roaster - we hope to challenge ourselves and our customers to push the envelope of what specialty coffee ‘should’ be and how it should taste.

notable: Founded by Kyle Ramage and Lem Butler, 2 U.S. Barista Champions

name: Blueprint Coffee
description: Blueprint Coffee seeks a mutually beneficial relationship loop among our producers, staff, wholesale partners, vendors, and customers – a loop rooted in and sustained by coffee excellence. Good coffee must be good from the start, so we collaborate with sourcing partners to ensure that our coffees are fresh, exciting, and sustainable. Precise roasting, brewing, training, and service models maintain the beauty in these coffees.

name: George Howell Coffee
description: We buy and roast the finest regional and single farm-sourced coffees for coffee lovers who share in our quest for the ultimate cup! We want our customers to join us as we explore the rainbow of coffee flavors. We treat our coffees with precision and care, from export to storage to roasting to cup.

notable: 2007 - Specialty Coffee Association of Europe’s highest honor, the Better Coffee World Award
George Howell conceived and co-founded the Cup of Excellence in 1999
Specialty Coffee Association of America (SCAA) awarded George its Lifetime Achievement Award in 1996

name: Heartwood Roastery
description: At heartwood, our mission is to grow together. this means every relationship we make, every partner we work with, every person in the supply chain should be growing, enriching their lives, and thriving from the interaction.

name: La Barba Coffee
description: At La Barba, good coffee is a coffee that satisfies your yearning for the ritual, aromas, flavors, and overall experience of the cup. Not only that, but "good coffee" is sourced and sold with consideration of its impact on the well being of farmers, laborers, exporters/importers, delivery drivers, La Barba employees, and customers.

name: Cxffeeblack
description: Cxffeeblack is a community-oriented, multi-disciplinary, education-based coffee company. Founded in 2019, by husband and wife team, Bartholomew Jones and Renata Henderson, this social enterprise is on a mission to return coffee to its African roots and in the process create an equitable Black future. Cxffeeblack became a trailblazer in the coffee industry by creating an entirely all Black coffee supply chain from Ethiopia to Memphis, TN, the first of its kind.

notable: 15th Annual Sprudgie Award for Most Notable Roaster of the Year
Inaugural Innovator of the Year Award from the Coffee Coalition for Racial Equity

name: Greater Goods Roasting
description: Greater Goods Coffee is a woman-owned, small-batch roasting company based in Dripping Springs, Texas. We’re on a mission to positively impact our communities at home and origin by offering a curated selection of delicious, responsibly-sourced specialty coffee.

notable: 2021 Micro Roaster of the Year - Roast Magazine
2023 Good Food Award
